document.heading: Earned Income Tax Credit Act of 2001

history.narrative: Law 14-22, the “Earned Income Tax Credit Act of 2001”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-21, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 3, 2001, and May 1, 2001, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 22, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 14-70 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-22 became effective on September 6, 2001.
